work.position: Course Project - Engineering Program and Project Management
work.summary: WAs part of a collaborative team project at Virginia Tech, I developed a Rental Forecasting Tool designed to predict rental demand and dynamic pricing for various rental properties. Utilized advanced statistical methods and data analysis tools to derive accurate rental cost equations and forecast models. Collaborated with a multidisciplinary team to ensure timely project delivery.

work.company: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
work.position: Course Project - MEMS Fabricated Continuous Sweat Glucose Monitor
work.summary: Engineered an enzyme-immobilized glucose monitor in 6 months, achieving a 700% lifespan improvement by optimizing enzyme immobilization and substrate configuration. Applied semiconductor fabrication techniques like photolithography, film deposition, masking, deposition, and etching.

work.company: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
work.position: Course Project - Embedded Package Design of a 100V GaN HEMT Device for EV Applications
work.summary: Designed and evaluated packaging techniques for GaN transistor to optimize thermal and electrical performance for electric vehicle applications. Conducted systematic electrical characterization using Finite Element Analysis (FEA) in ANSYS Q3D and performed thermal management analysis. Executed wire bond stress and strain tests, employing MIL-STD-883 Method 2011.9 and Method 2019.9 for bond pull and die shear strength testing.
Worked in an interdisciplinary team to develop a new Smart Cluster Management Software project. Designed a python program to retrieve real-time CPU and network usage for server applications.

work.position: Project - Piezo-Tribo Nanogenerator (PTNG) for Powering Wearable Gadgets
work.summary: Led an interdisciplinary team of 5 students to conduct a research study to develop and engineer a shoe-sole-embedded flexible nanogenerator to power wearable gadgets. Contributions included overseeing the team, organizing and dividing tasks, progress meetings, documentation, and presentations. Earned special mention from the university for innovation and was proposed for government funding.
